sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>child</radical> will ask if they want <radical>two</radical> <radical>water</radical>s because they need a grown-up's <kanji>consent</kanji>. Children aren't allowed to have whatever they want, they need to make sure it's okay and get consent first.
meaningInfo: Picture the child finishing their first water. They look at a big stack of bottled waters, but they know better than to just take two more, they need consent first. "Excuse me, sir, could I please have two more waters?" the child asks.
readingMnemonic: "Of course my child, you have my <kanji>consent</kanji>," comes the voice of the <reading>Shou</reading>gun (<ja>しょう</ja>). The Shougun is very pleased by this child, because he expects everyone to ask for consent around him.
readingInfo: You need to make sure to get express consent from the Shougun before you do most things. Especially if it's something like taking more than you've been given.
